title: Crashes cause major slowdown after traffic pattern shift on I-75
description: Drivers are going to keep noticing changes on I-75 in northern Montgomery County.
content:

Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article. This means the info may not always match what's in the article. Reporting mistakes helps us improve the experience. Generate Key Takeaways

Drivers on I-75 North in northern Montgomery County will experience a new traffic pattern as ODOT implements changes to improve safety.

The Ohio Department of Transportation (ODOT) has introduced a contraflow lane on I-75 North as part of a planned traffic pattern change.

This change, which began over the weekend, aims to enhance traffic flow and safety in the construction zone.

Despite the planned nature of these changes, two crashes occurred shortly after the new traffic pattern was implemented.
• None Over a dozen children found in Ohio home with ‘deplorable conditions;’ 3 arrested
• None Man found in sewer drain after large search forces shelter-in-place in Montgomery County
• None ‘End of an Era;’ Longtime ride closing at Kings Island

On Saturday, a motorcyclist collided with a concrete barrier wall near Needmore Road after attempting to avoid a slowing pickup truck.

This crash caused a traffic slowdown, leading to a second crash involving four cars in the contraflow lane near Wagner Ford.

ODOT is taking additional measures to improve safety in the area.

Plans include installing more signage and rumble strips, as well as painting new stripes on the highway.

These stripes will assist state troopers in monitoring speed from the air, a step aimed at reducing speeding and distracted driving.

State troopers have expressed their intention to increase their presence in the construction zone when possible, to further deter unsafe driving behaviors that can lead to accidents.

The Ohio Department of Transportation (ODOT) has implemented a contraflow lane on I-75 North in northern Montgomery County as part of a planned traffic pattern change, which aims to enhance traffic flow and safety in the construction zone. Despite these changes, two crashes occurred shortly after the new traffic pattern was implemented, leading to a significant traffic slowdown. Additional measures are being taken to improve safety in this area, including installing more signage and rumble strips and painting new stripes on the highway.
shortSummary: A new traffic pattern on I-75 North caused major delays, prompting two crashes, while additional safety measures were implemented to improve safety and effectiveness.
argos_summary: The Ohio Department of Transportation (ODOT) has implemented a new contraflow lane on I-75 North in northern Montgomery County to enhance traffic flow and safety in a construction zone. Despite these changes, two crashes occurred shortly after the new pattern was introduced, prompting ODOT to take additional safety measures, including installing more signage and rumble strips. State troopers plan to increase their presence in the area to deter unsafe driving behaviors.
